metadata.purpose: Complete essay structure templates for B2 Cambridge essays
metadata.usage: Powers structures-guide.html with phrase templates for each essay type
metadata.note: PEDAGOGICALLY CORRECT - Thesis statements, transitions, and body paragraphs are properly separated

for_and_against.title: For & Against Structure
for_and_against.purpose: Present both advantages and disadvantages objectively before reaching a balanced conclusion

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Introduce topic and set context (2-3 sentences)
phrases: Few people would deny that [topic] has become an essential part of daily life.
In recent times, [topic] has sparked considerable debate due to...
It is widely recognised that [topic] plays a crucial role in shaping today's society.
There is a growing recognition that [topic] can have both positive and negative effects.
Over the past few years, there has been a significant increase in the use of [topic].
It is common knowledge that [topic] has made a significant impact on modern lifestyles.
[Topic] has indisputably become inseparable from our everyday activities.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: State that both sides will be discussed
phrases: Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of [topic].
Hence, it is vitally important to consider the advantages and disadvantages of [topic].
Consequently, it is essential that we study the arguments in favour of and against [topic].
Thus, it becomes necessary to evaluate whether the advantages of [topic] outweigh its disadvantages.

arguments_for.label: Body Paragraph A - Arguments FOR
phrases: The main advantage of [topic] is that it...
One major benefit of [topic] is that it...
A further positive aspect of [topic] is that it...
The main argument in favour of [topic] is that it...
A key reason why many people support [topic] is because...
Supporters of [topic] often point out that it...
One benefit of [topic] is the fact that it...
Another strong point is that [topic] helps to...
A clear advantage of [topic] lies in its ability to...

transition_to_counter.label: Transition to Body Paragraph B
transition_to_counter.purpose: Signal shift from positive to negative aspects
phrases: While there are many advantages to [topic], it is also true that...
Although [topic] offers certain benefits, it also presents challenges.
Despite its positive sides, [topic] can cause some difficulties.
On the other hand, [topic] is not without its drawbacks.
However, we must also consider the negative aspects of [topic].
Nevertheless, [topic] has certain disadvantages that cannot be ignored.

arguments_against.label: Body Paragraph B - Arguments AGAINST
phrases: The key disadvantage of [topic] is that it...
A major drawback of [topic] is that it...
One clear limitation of [topic] is that it...
The obvious drawback of [topic] is that it may...
One negative aspect of [topic] is that it tends to...
A significant downside of [topic] is the risk of...
Critics of [topic] argue that it...
Opponents point out that [topic] can lead to...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarise both sides and state a balanced view
phrases: In conclusion, as far as I'm concerned, there are both advantages and disadvantages to [topic].
On balance, it seems that the benefits of [topic] outweigh the drawbacks, despite all the...
To sum up, as far as I can judge, while [topic] has its negative aspects, its advantages are more significant.
Overall, in all certainty [topic] can be seen as both beneficial and problematic in different ways.
All things considered, the decision regarding [topic] depends on individual circumstances.

problems_and_solutions.title: Problems & Solutions Structure
problems_and_solutions.purpose: Identify key problems and propose practical solutions

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Introduce the problem and its significance (2-3 sentences)
phrases: Nowadays/These days, the issue of [problem] has become increasingly serious.
It is generally believed that [problem] is causing significant difficulties in [area].
It is widely recognized that [problem] affects many aspects of modern life.
Few people would deny that [problem] is becoming more widespread and concerning.
Over the past few years, there has been a worrying rise in [problem].
Recent studies show that [problem] has become more common and complex.
In recent times, [problem] has attracted considerable public attention.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: State that problems and solutions will be discussed
phrases: Hence, it is vital we examine the causes of [problem] and explore possible solutions.
Therefore, it is vitally important to identify the main problems related to [topic] and discuss how they can be solved.
Consequently, it is essential that we look into both the reasons for [problem] and the measures that could help resolve it.
Therefore, it is vital that we analyse the key issues caused by [problem] and suggest effective remedies.

problems.label: Body Paragraph A - Problems
problems.purpose: Describe the main problems in detail
phrases: One of the main problems with [topic] is that...
A serious issue concerning [topic] is...
The most pressing problem is that...
A major concern is that [topic] leads to...
One significant difficulty is that...
A key challenge facing [area] is...
The primary issue stems from the fact that...

transition_to_solutions.label: Transition to Solutions
transition_to_solutions.purpose: Signal shift from problems to solutions
phrases: Fortunately, there are several measures that could address these issues.
However, practical solutions do exist to tackle these problems.
Nevertheless, effective steps can be taken to resolve these difficulties.
Despite these challenges, there are ways to improve the situation.

solutions_government.label: Body Paragraph B - Government/Institutional Solutions
phrases: One possible solution to this problem would be to...
A practical way to address this issue is to...
An effective measure could be to...
The government should take steps to...
Authorities could introduce policies that...
It is essential for governments to implement measures to...
If such measures were implemented, [problem] could be significantly reduced.
By taking these steps, society could lessen the impact of [problem].
These actions would help minimise the negative effects of [problem].

solutions_individual.label: Body Paragraph C - Individual Solutions (Optional)
phrases: On a personal level, individuals can contribute by...
At the community level, people could work together to...
Each person can make a difference by...
Local communities should encourage...
Citizens can play an active role by...
If everyone took responsibility for..., the situation would improve considerably.

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarize problems and express optimism about solutions
phrases: In conclusion, while [problem] poses serious challenges, effective solutions are available.
To sum up, although [problem] is a significant concern, both governments and individuals can take action.
Overall, if the measures discussed above are implemented, [problem] can be reduced substantially.
On balance, a combination of government action and individual responsibility offers the best chance of success.

cause_and_effect.title: Cause & Effect Structure
cause_and_effect.purpose: Analyze the causes of a situation and examine its resulting effects

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Introduce the phenomenon requiring explanation (2-3 sentences)
phrases: In recent years, [phenomenon] has become increasingly common worldwide.
Over the past decade, there has been a noticeable rise in [phenomenon].
It is widely acknowledged that [phenomenon] has changed the way people live.
Few would dispute that [phenomenon] has had a significant impact on society.
Nowadays, [phenomenon] affects millions of people across the globe.
Recent trends show that [phenomenon] continues to grow at an alarming rate.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: State that causes and effects will be analyzed
phrases: Therefore, it is vital to examine why [phenomenon] has occurred and what consequences it brings.
Hence, this essay will explore the main reasons behind [phenomenon] and its resulting effects.
Consequently, it is essential to analyse both the causes of [phenomenon] and its impact on society.
Thus, understanding the factors leading to [phenomenon] and its outcomes is crucial.

causes.label: Body Paragraph A - Causes
causes.purpose: Explain the main reasons behind the phenomenon
phrases: One of the primary causes of [phenomenon] is...
The main reason for [phenomenon] can be attributed to...
A key factor contributing to [phenomenon] is...
This trend has emerged largely because...
Several factors have led to [phenomenon], including...
The root cause of [phenomenon] lies in...
This situation has arisen due to...

transition_to_effects.label: Transition to Effects
transition_to_effects.purpose: Signal shift from causes to consequences
phrases: As a result of these developments, [phenomenon] has produced several significant effects.
Consequently, [phenomenon] has led to a number of important consequences.
These causes have resulted in various impacts on society.
The effects of [phenomenon] can be observed in multiple areas.

effects.label: Body Paragraph B - Effects
phrases: One major effect of [phenomenon] is that...
As a consequence, [phenomenon] has resulted in...
This has led to significant changes in...
The impact on [area] has been substantial, with...
One clear outcome is that...
Another important consequence is...
This trend has caused [group] to...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: In conclusion, [phenomenon] stems from multiple causes and produces wide-ranging effects.
To sum up, understanding both the reasons for [phenomenon] and its consequences is essential.
Overall, the causes and effects of [phenomenon] are closely interconnected.
On balance, [phenomenon] represents a complex issue with both deep roots and far-reaching impacts.

agree_and_disagree.title: Agree & Disagree Structure
agree_and_disagree.purpose: Present arguments for both sides of a statement before stating your opinion

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Introduce the topic and the debate (2-3 sentences)
phrases: The statement that '[statement]' has generated considerable debate in recent years.
There is ongoing discussion about whether [statement] is true.
People hold different views regarding the claim that [statement].
The question of whether [statement] has sparked much controversy.
Opinions are divided on the validity of the statement '[statement]'.
It is often argued that [statement], though not everyone agrees.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: State that both perspectives will be examined before giving opinion
phrases: Therefore, it is important to examine both sides of this argument before reaching a conclusion.
Hence, this essay will discuss arguments supporting and opposing this view before presenting my opinion.
Consequently, I will analyse the merits of both perspectives before stating my own position.
Thus, it is essential to consider the evidence on both sides before forming a judgment.

arguments_agree.label: Body Paragraph A - Arguments AGREEING
phrases: Those who agree with this statement argue that...
Supporters of this view point out that...
One strong argument in favour of this position is that...
People who hold this opinion believe that...
It can be argued that [statement] because...
Evidence suggests that [statement] is valid, as...

transition_to_disagree.label: Transition to Opposing View
phrases: On the other hand, there are those who disagree with this statement.
However, critics of this view maintain that...
Nevertheless, opponents argue that...
Despite these points, many people believe the opposite.
Conversely, some would argue that...

arguments_disagree.label: Body Paragraph B - Arguments DISAGREEING
phrases: Those who disagree argue that...
Critics point out that...
A strong counter-argument is that...
People who oppose this view believe that...
It could be argued that [statement] is not valid because...
Evidence contradicting this claim includes...

personal_opinion.label: Body Paragraph C - Your Opinion
personal_opinion.purpose: State and defend your personal position
phrases: In my opinion, I tend to agree with the statement because...
Personally, I believe that [statement] is largely accurate because...
From my perspective, the arguments in favour outweigh those against.
As far as I'm concerned, the evidence supports the view that...
I would argue that [statement] is valid, though with some reservations.

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Restate your position after considering both sides
phrases: In conclusion, while both perspectives have merit, I believe that...
To sum up, after examining both sides, my position is that...
Overall, despite valid arguments on both sides, I tend to agree/disagree that...
On balance, the evidence suggests that the statement is largely correct/incorrect.

opinion.title: Opinion Structure
opinion.purpose: Express and defend a clear personal viewpoint throughout the essay

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Introduce the topic and set context (2-3 sentences)
phrases: Few people would deny that [topic] has become an important issue in modern society.
In recent years, [topic] has attracted considerable attention and debate.
It is widely acknowledged that [topic] plays a significant role in contemporary life.
The question of [topic] has sparked much discussion among experts and the public alike.
There is growing concern/interest regarding [topic] and its implications.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
phrases: From my perspective, I firmly believe that [opinion].
In my view, [opinion] for several compelling reasons.
Personally, I am convinced that [opinion].
I tend to believe that [opinion].
There is no doubt in my mind that [opinion].
I am of the opinion that [opinion].
It seems to me that [opinion].

argument_1.label: Body Paragraph A - First Argument
phrases: I firmly believe that [aspect] plays an essential role in...
The main reason is that...
For example, [evidence] demonstrates that...
As a result, [consequence].
One key factor supporting my view is that...
Evidence clearly shows that...
This is particularly important because...

argument_2.label: Body Paragraph B - Second Argument
argument_2.purpose: Add another supporting reason to strengthen your position
phrases: Furthermore, I believe that [aspect]...
Another reason I support this view is that...
Additionally, [evidence] has proven to...
Moreover, the benefits include...
In addition, [aspect] contributes to...
A second important consideration is that...

counter_argument.label: Body Paragraph C - Counter-argument (Optional)
counter_argument.purpose: Acknowledge opposing views but refute them
phrases: Admittedly, some people argue that...
While critics claim that [opposing view]...
Although it is true that [opposing view]...
However, I would argue that...
Nevertheless, the benefits clearly outweigh...
Despite these concerns, I maintain that...
This criticism fails to consider that...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Restate your opinion and summarize key points
phrases: In conclusion, I strongly believe that [opinion].
To sum up, my view is that [opinion].
Overall, I am convinced that [opinion].
On balance, it seems clear that [opinion].
For these reasons, I firmly maintain that [opinion].

speculation_and_trends.title: Speculation, Generalisation & Trends Structure
speculation_and_trends.purpose: Analyze current trends and make predictions about future developments

introduction.label: Introduction - Context
introduction.purpose: Identify the trend and its current state (2-3 sentences)
phrases: Nowadays/These days, society is witnessing a remarkable change in [area/topic].
Over the past few years, there has been a growing trend towards [trend].
It is increasingly common to see [trend] becoming a normal part of life.
In recent times, attitudes towards [topic] have shifted significantly.
There is a noticeable movement in society towards [trend].
It is widely observed that [group/people] are becoming more interested in [trend].
Recent developments suggest that [trend] will continue to expand in the near future.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis Statement (Last sentence of Introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: State that the trend's causes and future will be explored
phrases: Hence, this essay will explore the main reasons behind this trend and its possible future implications.
Therefore, it is important to examine what has led to this change and how it might develop further.
Consequently, this essay will discuss the factors contributing to [trend] and consider what the future may hold.
Thus, the following paragraphs will analyse the causes of this growing tendency and its likely effects.

current_trends.label: Body Paragraph A - Current Trends & Causes
current_trends.purpose: Describe and analyze the present trend and why it's happening
phrases: Currently, [trend] is becoming increasingly popular because...
At present, many people are choosing to [action] due to...
Today, [trend] is widespread as a result of...
In the present day, [trend] has become common because...
This shift can be attributed to several factors, including...
The main reason for this development is...
People are increasingly drawn to [trend] because it offers...

transition_to_future.label: Transition to Future Predictions
transition_to_future.purpose: Signal shift from present to future
phrases: Looking ahead, several predictions can be made about how this trend will develop.
As we move into the future, it is likely that...
Considering current patterns, we can anticipate that...
The future trajectory of this trend suggests that...

future_predictions.label: Body Paragraph B - Future Predictions
future_predictions.purpose: Make informed predictions about future developments
phrases: It is likely that [trend] will continue to grow in the coming years.
It is expected that [trend] will become even more widespread.
In all likelihood, [trend] will remain a dominant feature...
If current patterns persist, [future result] can be expected.
Should this trend continue, it could lead to [effect].
Unless major changes occur, [trend] will probably intensify.
The long-term consequences of this trend may include [outcome].
As this trend develops further, we may begin to see [effect].
In the future, [trend] could significantly influence [area/behaviour].

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Make final predictions about the trend's trajectory
phrases: In conclusion, the growing trend towards [topic] is likely to shape the future of [area].
To sum up, the evidence suggests that [trend] will continue to expand in importance.
Overall, it seems clear that social and technological changes are driving this development.
On balance, this trend reflects deeper transformations within modern society.
Looking forward, [trend] will probably become an even more central feature of modern life.
